org.rlcommunity.environments.octopus.odeframework
Interface ODEEquationPart

All Known Implementing Classes:
ArmBase, Food, Node, ODEEquationPartAggregate, UnconstrainedNode
public interface ODEEquationPart

A physical entity whose state is defined by a subset of an ODE system's state variables. The entity may be simple (indivisible) or compound. Using aggregate, entities may be hierarchically nested, with the root representing the entire system.

This interface, together with PartBasedEquation, allow "physical" class models, where objects directly represent physical entities, to be viewed as ODEEquations and thus used with ODE solvers. While ODE solvers might require the computation of derivatives at arbitrary times and states, entities in physical class models might not be able to compute derivatives at any state other than the current system state, particularly if they depend on the states of other entities in the system.

To work around this limitation, the notion of an assumed time and state is introduced. This is the time and state that an ODEEquationPart must assume upon calls to getODEStateDerivative(), and is set with assumeTimeAndState(double, org.rlcommunity.environments.octopus.odeframework.ODEState). It is guaranteed upon each call to getODEStateDerivative that the entire ODE system will be assuming the same time and state given in the last call to assumeTimeAndState.

Method Summary

 ODEState getODEStateDerivative()

 int getStateLength()
          Returns how many state variables this object expects.
 

Method Detail

getStateLength

int getStateLength()
Returns how many state variables this object expects.

Returns:
The number of doubles in the state of this object.

assumeTimeAndState

void assumeTimeAndState(double time,
                        ODEState state)

Causes the object to assume the time and state given. This method is used for "priming" the object for a subsequent call to getODEStateDerivative during a solution step. It can also be used to update the "real" state of the object after a solution step, in which case the time parameter is insignificant.

Parameters:
time - the assumed time
state - the assumed state

getCurrentODEState

ODEState getCurrentODEState()

Returns the current (assumed) state of this ODEEquationPart.

Returns:
The current state as an array of double values.

getODEStateDerivative

ODEState getODEStateDerivative()

Returns the values of the state variable derivatives, evaluated at the current assumed time and state.

Returns:
the state variable derivatives at the current assumed a time and state
